name: Timber Industry Brexit Forum
memberOrga: Balcas, Enniskillen, Co Fermanagh; Coolrain Sawmills, Coolrain, Portlaoise, Co Laois; ECC Timber Products, Corr na Mona, Co Galway; Glennon Brothers,  Dublin Road, Co Longford & Fermoy, Co Cork; GP Wood, Enniskeane, Co Cork; Laois Sawmills, Drumsna, Carrick-on-Shannon, Co Leitrim; Murray Timber Group, Ballygar, Co Galway & Ballon, Co Carlow and Woodfab Timber, Tinnakilly, Aughrim, Co Wicklow
goal: To raise awareness of the importance of the Timber Industry in Ireland along with the significant threats that Brexit presents for the industry, and to develop strategies that will minimise the negative impact of Brexit on the industry
interests: Agriculture, Borders and Security, Business and Industry, Climate Action, Customs, Economy, finance and the euro, Energy, Environment, Regional Policy, Single market, Trade, Trans-European Networks, Transport
euInitiatives: The TIBF is primarily engaged in awareness raising through various meetings, events and printed reports related to Brexit
